channel.title: Jing (Jane) Li | Penn Computational Intelligence Lab

item.title: PennCIL scores Best Paper Award at 2023 ACM International Symposium on FPGAs
item.description:
Congratulations to PennCIL Lab members Linus Y. Wong, Jialiang Zhang, and Prof. Jing (Jane) Li for winning the Best Paper Award at the 2023 ACM/SIGDA International Symposium on Field-Programmable Gate Array for the paper “DONGLE: Direct FPGA-Orchestrated NVMe Storage for HLS”.

The annual ACM/SIGDA International Symposium is one of the oldest and the most prestigious conference in FPGA and reconfigurable computing. This year’s Best Paper Award was selected from a total of 82 submissions from industry and academia, out of which 21% of the reviewed papers were finally shortlisted for regular presentation at the conference and 1 was selected as the best paper. More can be found at https://www.isfpga.org
